creator: Hirschkorn
descriptionHtml:
Wakening is an alarm clock app that uses the gradually increasing sound of ocean waves and light (from the phone screen) to gently ease you out of sleep. Being shocked awake by a loud alarm clock while in deep sleep is always unpleasant. But if you are exposed to light and pleasant sounds some period of time before you need to get up (such as 20 to 30 minutes), you will likely be pulled out of sleep at a lighter phase of the sleep cycle, leading to a more pleasant morning.

Wakening is not the first alarm clock app to offer this functionality, but it is attractive, intuitive and simple to use. It is completely free with no ads. It follows Android Material interface design philosophy, and uses a dark theme (or automatically selects based on your theme setting on Android versions Q and later) while setting your alarms, since you don't want to be staring at a bright screen before bed.

Why you might like Wakening:
- Free
- Ad-free
- No permissions requested
- Simple, intuitive and easy-to-use
- Dark theme

Features:
- Create multiple alarms that recur on specified days each week
- Choose the transition time for sound and light to increase
- Choose the color of the screen to wake up to
- Wake up to the pleasant sounds of ocean waves crashing over the shore at the Bay of Fundy
- If you are still not awake when the sound is at full volume and the light is at full brightness, you will also hear the sound of sea birds, which are a bit harder to sleep through
- Test your defined alarms to see what it will look and sound like when you wake up
- Offset or skip the next alarm if you know you don't need to wake up the next day, and the normal schedule will resume afterwards
- Snooze the alarm if you want to sleep a bit later

However, Wakening can not be everything for everyone, and it might not be for you if:
- you are a deep sleeper and need really disturbing noises to wake up and stay up. Wakening uses soft, pleasant sounds that might be enough to wake everyone.
- you sleep in a bright, noisy environment. The app depends on the phone screen and speakers to wake you, and they can only do so much.
- you need a lot of customized options. While more features will be added in time, it is currently fairly simple.
descriptionShort: Wake up gently with gradually increasing light and ocean waves

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: First release

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- Fix for failing to wake screen on P20
- Changed alarm volume behaviour. Alarm volumes are no longer synchronized with Android's alarm volume, since that setting gets unexpectedly modified by other apps. Instead, Wakening now stores volume for each alarm definition and applies it when the alarm activates. This could mean that your alarm volume setting has changes, so please verify your alarm volumes.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- Updated Android dependencies
- Fixed display of next alarm, which didn't correctly show "Today" or "Tomorrow" on New Year's Eve
- Fixed bug where skipped alarms would not reset after time had passed

title: Wakening - Gradual Alarm

creator: Hirschkorn
descriptionHtml:
Wakening is an alarm clock app that uses the gradually increasing sounds and light (from the phone screen) to gently ease you out of sleep. Being shocked awake by a loud alarm clock while in deep sleep is always unpleasant. But if you are exposed to light and pleasant sounds some period of time before you need to get up (such as 20 to 30 minutes), you will likely be pulled out of sleep at a lighter phase of the sleep cycle, leading to a more pleasant morning.

Wakening is not the first alarm clock app to offer this functionality, but it is attractive, intuitive and simple to use. It has high-quality sound samples so you can wake up to ocean waves, rain drops or whatever sound files you want to choose. It is completely free with no ads. It follows Android Material interface design philosophy, and uses a dark theme (or automatically selects based on your theme setting on Android versions Q and later) while setting your alarms, since you don't want to be staring at a bright screen before bed.

Why you might like Wakening:
- Free
- Ad-free
- No permissions requested
- Simple, intuitive and easy-to-use
- Dark theme

Features:
- Create multiple alarms that recur on specified days each week
- Choose the transition time for sound and light to increase
- Choose the color of the screen to wake up to
- Wake up to the pleasant sounds of ocean waves crashing over the shore at the Bay of Fundy, or a tea kettle boiling, rain falling, or your choice of any sound file
- If you are still not awake when the sound is at full volume and the light is at full brightness, the sound will become more immediate and hard to sleep through
- Test your defined alarms to see what it will look and sound like when you wake up
- Offset or skip the next alarm if you know you don't need to wake up the next day, and the normal schedule will resume afterwards
- Snooze the alarm if you want to sleep a bit later

However, Wakening can not be everything for everyone, and it might not be for you if:
- you are a deep sleeper and need really disturbing noises to wake up and stay up. Wakening uses soft, pleasant sounds that might be enough to wake everyone. While you can choose your own sounds that can be louder, the gradual wake up is what makes Wakening special.
- you sleep in a bright, noisy environment. The app depends on the phone screen and speakers to wake you, and they can only do so much.
descriptionShort: Wake up gently with gradually increasing light and ocean waves

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- Big feature! New sound themes, or choose your own sounds
- Removed gaps between playback of wake and alarm sounds
- Reversed positions of + and - buttons for next alarm
- Reduced font size - it was a little too big

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
The previous (1.2.0) release would crash for some users on next alarm recurrence after the app update. Sorry to anyone who was affected by this. It would only happen once after update, and it should be fixed now for everyone else, but please let me know if you have any other problems at wakening@fastmail.com.
Other release details:
- Added proper attribution to the creators of the sounds used in the new sound themes

title: Wakening - Gradual Alarm

creator: Hirschkorn
descriptionHtml:
● Wake up gently: Wake up gradually with pleasant sounds and increasing light
● Beautiful high-quality sounds: Choose the sound of ocean waves, forest rain, a bubbling tea kettle, or pick your own sounds
● Multiple recurring alarms: Set which days of the week the alarms repeat
● Offset or skip the next alarm: One tap to offset or skip the next alarm without resetting the recurring schedule
● Dark theme: No need to stare at bright lights while setting your alarm
● Customize your alarms: Choose the time to gradually wake up, the screen color, volume and brightness
● Free - No ads - No purchases

Wakening is an alarm app that gradually brightens the screen and play's pleasant sound that gently get louder, helping you wake up peacefully. It has all the features you expect from an alarm clock, but lets you wake refreshed instead of being shocked awake every morning.
descriptionShort: Wake up gently with gradually increasing light and pleasant sounds

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- Added days to time remaining text
- Try to fix problem where alarm doesn't show over lock screen on some phones

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- Changed button color to make disabled weekdays clearer
- Added vibration on alarm option
- Added check for AOD apps, which prevent alarms from showing
- Added options to replace snooze and stop buttons with sliders to prevent accidental triggering
- Added options to snooze or stop from volume buttons
- Added brightness fade in at start to avoid flashes
- Fixed crash when alarm goes off in landscape
- Added screen saver - alarm screen drifts in a circle
- Added confirmation when deleting alarm
